Class Map

java.lang.Object
Map
public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
The game takes place on map. entering specific coordinates in a map triggers action like battle, chest pick up or enter/exit to new map(zone) Map is represented as 2d array of Strings and its elements are represented by letters. C = chest, P = Player, X = empty space, E = previous/next map
Author:
Jakub

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Map​(int zone)
    Each map zone and its elements is set up in the Maps class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean checkChest​(Player player)
    check if player position equals position of a chest, if so and chest wasn't picked before - player gains its contents
    void checkMap()
    out.println() the current map the player is in to the console
    boolean checkTransition​(Player player)
    Check if player coordinates equal to zone exit coordinates of current map, if so and other conditions are met, the player enters new zone via enterNewZone
    void fillMap​(Letter l)  
    void fillMap​(Letter letter, java.util.ArrayList<int[][]> enterExitZones)  
    void fillMap​(Letter letter, java.util.ArrayList<int[][]> enterExitZones, java.util.ArrayList<int[]> chests)
    fill adventure map with action elements like chests, exits, NPCs and monsters
    Field[][] getFieldMap()  
    java.util.ArrayList<int[][]> getMapExits()  
    int getMapIndex()  
    int[] getMapSize()  
    int[] getTransitionPlayerPos​(Player player, int[] lastMapSize)
    if the exit zone in last map was located in right corner, the player position enters new zone on the left side, entering from Y index 0(top of the map) would mean the player is positioned at new map size -1(bottom) coordinate Y
    void movePlayer​(Player player, int move)
    player changes position, after the move check if player is interacting with any action fields and if so take according action in regard to what field the player is on.
    void positionPlayer​(Player player)
    position player on the map and check if he is interacting with any object after successful movement.
    void setFieldMap​(Field[][] fieldMap)  
    void setMapExits​(java.util.ArrayList<int[][]> mapExits)  
    void setMapIndex​(int mapIndex)  
    void setMapSize​(int[] mapSize)

  • Constructor Details

    • Map

      public Map​(int zone)
      Each map zone and its elements is set up in the Maps class. pass the zone int to the Map constructor in order to create new map zone by pulling details from the Maps class.

    • checkMap

      public void checkMap()
      out.println() the current map the player is in to the console

    • fillMap

      public void fillMap​(Letter letter, java.util.ArrayList<int[][]> enterExitZones, java.util.ArrayList<int[]> chests)
      fill adventure map with action elements like chests, exits, NPCs and monsters
      Parameters:
      letter - fill the whole map with this letter initially, blank space is represented by X
      enterExitZones - if the map contains EXIT ZONES, place them on the map by changing from letter X to E
      chests - if the map contains TRESURE CHESTS, place them on the map by changing from letter C to E

    • fillMap

      public void fillMap​(Letter letter, java.util.ArrayList<int[][]> enterExitZones)

    • fillMap

      public void fillMap​(Letter l)

    • positionPlayer

      public void positionPlayer​(Player player)
      position player on the map and check if he is interacting with any object after successful movement.

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer​(Player player, int move)
      player changes position, after the move check if player is interacting with any action fields and if so take according action in regard to what field the player is on. This is main way in which the player moves around the map.
      Parameters:
      player -
      move - 1 = go up 1 index in 2d array = Y=Y-1-;. 2 = down = Y=Y+1;; 3 = right = X=X+1; 4 = left = X=X-1;

    • checkTransition

      public boolean checkTransition​(Player player)
      Check if player coordinates equal to zone exit coordinates of current map, if so and other conditions are met, the player enters new zone via enterNewZone

    • getTransitionPlayerPos

      public int[] getTransitionPlayerPos​(Player player, int[] lastMapSize)
      if the exit zone in last map was located in right corner, the player position enters new zone on the left side, entering from Y index 0(top of the map) would mean the player is positioned at new map size -1(bottom) coordinate Y

    • checkChest

      public boolean checkChest​(Player player)
      check if player position equals position of a chest, if so and chest wasn't picked before - player gains its contents
